question.title: Failed to initialize JPA EntityManagerFactory: Unable to build Hibernate SessionFactory
question.body:
I'm new to Java programming and while trying basic programming, I tried to connect java with Mysql Db where i am facing below issue,

Failed to initialize JPA EntityManagerFactory: Unable to build Hibernate SessionFactory

Below is the application property file

spring.datasource.url=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/ems
spring.datasource.username = root
spring.database.password = Mysql@123

spring.jpa.properties.hibernate.dialect = org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLDialect
spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto = update

below is the employee java class file

package net.javaguides.ems.entity;

import jakarta.persistence.*;
import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
import lombok.Getter;
import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
import lombok.Setter;

@Getter
@Setter
@NoArgsConstructor
@AllArgsConstructor
@Entity
@Table(name="employees")
public class Employee {

    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    private Long id;

    @Column(name = "first_name")
    private String firstName;

    @Column(name = "last_name")
    private String lastName;

    @Column(name = "email_id", nullable = false, unique = true)
    private String email;
}

answers.body:
Try configuring your datasource without any spaces around the = sign, because Spring Boot does not trim property keys, and properties with spaces are treated as different keys.

Also, make sure you are using the correct property name for the password.

spring.datasource.url=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/ems
spring.datasource.username=root
spring.datasource.password=Mysql@123

Because the password property was not being read correctly, Spring attempted to connect to MySQL without a password, which resulted in:

Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost' (using password: NO)

question_comments.body: also use the driver class # The driver class name below is often optional as Spring Boot can infer it 'spring.datasource.driver-class-name=com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Drive‌​r'
Should not it be spring.datasource.password instead of spring.database.password? According to the error message, password is not set during authentication.
